title: Gay Hamilton
text:
Gay Hamilton (born 29 April 1943, <a href="Hamilton%2C%20South%20Lanarkshire">Hamilton, South Lanarkshire</a>) is a <a href="Scotland">Scottish actress</a>. Her <a href="filmography">filmography</a> notably includes <a href="Stanley%20Kubrick">Stanley Kubrick</a>'s "<a href="Barry%20Lyndon">Barry Lyndon</a>" and <a href="Ridley%20Scott">Ridley Scott</a>'s "<a href="The%20Duellists">The Duellists</a>".
In the late 1960s/early 1970s, she was love interest and later wife of Detective Chief Superintendent John Watt (played by <a href="Frank%20Windsor">Frank Windsor</a>) in the <a href="TV%20series">TV series</a> "<a href="Softly%2C%20Softly%20%28television%20series%29">Softly, Softly</a>" and its "" spin-off.
She appeared in two episodes of the <a href="ITC%20Entertainment">ITC</a> series "<a href="Man%20in%20a%20Suitcase">Man in a Suitcase</a>" (1967), and played Eva Zoref, the wife of Anton Zoref (<a href="Ian%20McShane">Ian McShane</a>), in the "" episode "Force of Life" (1975). In 1980 she played the part of Dr. Claire Wilson in the "<a href="Shoestring%20%28TV%20series%29">Shoestring</a>" episode "The Farmer had a Wife". She more recently played Edwina Dunn in "<a href="EastEnders">EastEnders</a>" and Maisie McLintock in "<a href="Doctors%20%282000%20TV%20series%29">Doctors</a>".
